title: Deinego hails progress in humanitarian talks
content:
(BelTA) – Progress has been made in humanitarian negotiations, representative of the self-proclaimed Lugansk People's Republic in the contact group on Ukraine Vladislav Deinego told media on 8 September, BelTA informs. 
“We can see a certain progress in what concerns humanitarian and economic issues. Unfortunately, last week we had no chance of bringing experts to assess the facilities that need to be restored. Today's meeting will finalize the list of such facilities,” said Vladislav Deinego. 

The representative of the self-proclaimed Lugansk People's Republic stressed the importance of restoring water supplies, power lines and railway tracks in the first place. “We expect that the working schedule for experts will be ready next week,” Vladislav Deinego added.
